title: Looking for a condensed font with a large x-height
content:
Hello!

It's my first time here, so I'll quickly introduce myself: I'm Carel Fransen, graphic designer from the Netherlands, and currently working on my graduation projects.

For my project, I'm looking for a quality condensed font with a large x-height that does great at small corps-sizes (approx. 6-7 pt).

I have got one font that works very well: [Bureau Grot Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713092314/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/bureau-grot/light/). However, I'd like to have some options. Unfortunately, due to the "advanced search"-mechanisms on big font-sites not being that advanced, it's nearly impossible to search for something this specific.

I hope that some of you might be able to give me some recommendations. Preferably, I'd like a font with some Opentype-features like different kinds of figures, but most importantly it should be a bit condensed, readable at small sizes, and kerned nicely.

Thank you in advance!

Kind regards,

Carel
author: carelfransen

comments.content:
Stone Sans, which has a high x-height and includes a condensed series with book formatting using a range of weights, was reworked in 2010 as Stone Sans II [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-sans-ii/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713092314/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-sans-ii/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-sans-ii/")  
Might be worth your while to check whether it meets your needs.  
Don

If you have enough resolution, this  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/laudatio-bq/regular-cnd/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713092314/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/laudatio-bq/regular-cnd/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/laudatio-bq/regular-cnd/")  
can work awesome.

Just be careful, since small type prefers to be wide.

hhp

Lucas de Groot has some nice condensed typefaces with fairly large x-heights, for instance [Corpid Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713092314/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/corpid/corpid-condensed/) or [taz Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713092314/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/taz/taz-condensed/).
Thanks for the suggestions so far! I like the fonts, especially Corpid looks very nice, it has a friendly touch.
